As of 2009, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 271,454 and the [[population density|density]] of 6,510 persons per km². The total area is 41.71 km². Yao is home to a [[general aviation]] airport, [[Yao Airport]]. The city was founded on April 1, 1948. It is perhaps best known for its [[Kawachi ondo]] festival. The first day features dancers in colorful costumes parading along the street. The second day is a huge [[Bon_Odori#Bon_Odori|bon odori]] on the grounds of Yao high school where hundreds of people gather to dance and celebrate their historic song and dance. ==Transportation== ===Airports=== *[[Yao Airport]] ===Railways=== *[[West Japan Railway Company]] **[[Yamatoji Line]]: [[Shiki Station (Osaka)|Shiki Station]] -
